#Text=Modern radio drama Paranoria , TX releases 100th episode
#Text=Thursday , February 16 , 2017
#Text=Paranoria , TX , a modern radio drama hosted at internet -based AstroNet Radio , released its 100th episode .
#Text=The episode is titled The People 's Choice and aired on Monday .
#Text=Interior shot of AstroNet Radio studios based in Tyler , Texas(US)Image : Paul Budd .
#Text=The station 's web site describes the show as " old school radio theater with a new and outrageous geeky spin ! "

column1: #Text=In its early days , the show was featured solely at the long-running internet radio site TogiNet Radio , a site focused on talk radio .
#Text=In late 2015 , TogiNet established AstroNet Radio as a subsidiary station .
#Text=The show originally featured amateur voice actors , local to East Texas .
#Text=After some time , professional actors/talent came to be featured intermittently .
#Text=Some of those were
#Text=Kevin Betzer from television series Deep South Paranormal .
#Text=Clu Gulager notably from The Virginian and The Fall Guy .
#Text=John Gulager notably as director of Piranha 3DD .
#Text=Diane Ayala
#Text=Goldner
#Text=notably from horror film franchise Feast .
#Text=Vernon Wells notably from the films Mad Max 2 : The Road Warrior and Weird Science .
#Text=Wikinews caught up with the show 's producer , George Jones , to discuss the show .
#Text=( ( WN ) )
#Text=First , tell our readers about Paranoria , Texas .
#Text=George Jones : Paranoria , TX started out as a little show that could .
#Text=We really did n't know what we were doing but we wanted to do Old School radio in a brand new format which consisted of a new script every week with a cast of voice actors .
#Text=The result was a surprising hit and now the show has grown into something completely different than what it was in the beginning and we have followers worldwide .
#Text=The basic premise of the story is that there is a group of nerds who come together plotting to take over the world but end up saving it time and again .
#Text=( ( WN ) )
#Text=When did the idea for the show first come to you ?
#Text=GJ : I was called into the [ TogiNet ] studio for an interview about one of my events and while I was there the DJ asked me if I had ever thought about doing a radio show myself .
#Text=I had no idea what I was going to do but I was intrigued and after a little brainstorming and utilizing my own creativity the show was born .
#Text=( ( WN ) )
#Text=You 've written most of the scripts , right ?
#Text=Has anyone else helped you with writing ?
#Text=GJ : I have written 90 % of the scripts for the show .
#Text=Eric Nivens , Alan Mendez , Jeremy Nagel and Matt McBride have also written a few scripts .
#Text=It gets tough running a brand new 20-page script every week but somehow we 've managed for almost a hundred weeks .
#Text=We thank God for fans who keep us going , otherwise it would not have made it for so long .
#Text=Jones estimates since the first episode , the show has been downloaded roughly 30,000 times .
#Text=The show is set to feature a spin-off series soon .
